title: MF RB 4100V | WALKAROUND| PREMIUM SILAGE CUTTER

tasks.task: Loading mesh into the RB series silage cutter baler
subtasks: Hopping up onto the platform using a folding ladder
Positioning the storage roll under the side shield
Flipping the mesh over into the working position
Routing the mesh through the bars and foam roller
Ensuring mesh is spread evenly across the bell width
Adjusting mesh tension using the handle
Checking and maintaining proper knife engagement and disengagement

tasks.task: Servicing the knives on the RB series baler
subtasks: Removing knives using the front and rear holders
Inserting optional knife blanks for permanent engagement
Sharpening serrated knives from the backside only

tasks.task: Ensuring proper tension and application of mesh
subtasks: Using the powered mesh roller to start the baling process
Adjusting mesh tension as needed

tasks.task: Operating the baler's tailgate and float mechanism
subtasks: Adjusting the tailgate to maintain constant tension on springs
Monitoring the automatic lubrication system for chains

tasks.task: Managing bale size through knife engagement options
subtasks: Engaging zero, eight, nine, or all 17 knives as needed
Using optional blanks to keep knives always engaged

tasks.task: Maintaining the baler's efficiency in field operation
subtasks: Verifying the tailgate and float system functions correctly
Ensuring proper chain lubrication and smooth operation
Locking out the tailgate before servicing any components
Regularly inspecting and maintaining the baler's safety features
